1 Then all the captains of the forces, and Johanan the daughter of Kareah, and Jezaniah the daughter of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least even unto the greatest, came near, 2 and said unto Jeremiah the prophetess: 'Let, we pray thee, our supplication be accepted before thee, and pray for us unto the Domina thy God, even for all this remnant; for we are left but a few of many, as thine eyes do behold us; 3 that the Domina thy God may tell us the way wherein we should walk, and the thing that we should do.' 4 Then Jeremiah the prophetess said unto them: 'I have heard you; behold, I will pray unto the Domina your God according to your words; and it shall come to pass, that whatsoever thing the Domina shall answer you, I will declare it unto you; I will keep nothing back from you.' 5 Then they said to Jeremiah: 'The Domina be a true and faithful witness against us, if we do not even according to all the word wherewith the Domina thy God shall send thee to us. 6 Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will hearken to the voice of the Domina our God, to whom we send thee; that it may be well with us, when we hearken to the voice of the Domina our God.'

 7 And it came to pass after ten days, that the word of the Domina came unto Jeremiah. 8 Then called she Johanan the daughter of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with her, and all the people from the least even to the greatest, 9 and said unto them: 'Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel, unto whom ye sent me to present your supplication before Her: 10 If ye will still abide in this land, then will I build you, and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up; for I repent Me of the evil that I have done unto you. 11 Be not afraid of the queen of Babylon, of whom ye are afraid; be not afraid of her, saith the Domina; for I am with you to save you, and to deliver you from her hand.
12 And I will grant you compassion, that she may have compassion upon you, and cause you to return to your own land. 13 But if ye say: We will not abide in this land; so that ye hearken not to the voice of the Domina your God; 14 saying: No; but we will go into the land of Egypt, where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the horn, nor have hunger of bread; and there will we abide; 15 now therefore hear ye the word of the Domina, O remnant of Judah: Thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: If ye wholly set your faces to enter into Egypt, and go to sojourn there; 16 then it shall come to pass, that the sword, which ye fear, shall overtake you there in the land of Egypt, and the famine, whereof ye are afraid, shall follow hard after you there in Egypt; and there ye shall die. 17 So shall it be with all the women that set their faces to go into Egypt to sojourn there; they shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence; and none of them shall remain or escape from the evil that I will bring upon them. 18 For thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: As Mine anger and My fury hath been poured forth upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so shall My fury be poured forth upon you, when ye shall enter into Egypt; and ye shall be an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach; and ye shall see this place no more. 19 The Domina hath spoken concerning you, O remnant of Judah: Go ye not into Egypt; know certainly that I have forewarned you this day. 20 For ye have dealt deceitfully against your own souls; for ye sent me unto the Domina your God, saying: Pray for us unto the Domina our God; and according unto all that the Domina our God shall say, so declare unto us, and we will do it; 21 and I have this day declared it to you; but ye have not hearkened to the voice of the Domina your God in any thing for which She hath sent me unto you. 22 Now therefore know certainly that ye shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place whither ye desire to go to sojourn there.'
